content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 9650.3 - Responsibilities of records access officer

State Regulations

The record access officer shall have the following
responsibilities: (a) maintain a
reasonably detailed current subject matter list of all records in the
possession of the authority, whether or not such records are available for
inspection and copying pursuant to the Freedom of Information Law. The list
shall be of sufficient detail to permit identification by the public of
categories of records. The subject matter list shall be updated not less than
twice per year and the date of the most recent revision of the list shall
appear on its first page. (b) assist
members of the public in identifying requested records; (c) when requested records are located, either make such records available for inspection or deny access to such
records in whole or in part, with a written statement of the grounds for denial
of access; (d) upon request for
copies of records, either arrange to make copies available on payment of or
offer to pay the established fee or shall permit the requesting party to copy
the records; (e) upon request, certify that a copy of a record is a true copy; and
(f) upon failure to locate records, state in
writing that the Authority is not the custodian of such records or that the
records cannot be found after diligent search. Notes
